CatDescriptText: Mr. Joseph Mazer, retired restaurant owner, 5606 Kamin Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 6, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that too much leniency is shown teenagers who commit crimes?" answer reads: "Yes. I think that they should change the law and give young criminals just what is coming to them.  I mean that the legal age should be changed from 18 to 16."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joseph Mazer wearing patterned button down coat and dark necktie, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Thrift Drugs and Lorraine's stores in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
